text: Otis Ray Redding Jr. (September 9, 1941 - December 10, 1967) was an American singer and songwriter. He was an African American who was born in Dawson, Georgia. He wrote and sang many popular songs. He was killed in a plane crash at the age of 26 in Madison, Wisconsin. Shortly after his death, his song "Sittin' on the Dock of The Bay", went to # 1 on the charts. His music was magnificent and his songs moved many. He was a great man and a talented artist. He wrote the song, "Respect", which became a smash hit for Aretha Franklin. ==Notes== Category:1941 births Category:1967 deaths Category:African-American musicians Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American soul musicians Category:Aviation deaths in the United States Category:Singers from Georgia (U.S. state)
title: Otis Redding
